title: transferring Firefox bookmarks and login info from a Time Machine backup
content: I recently "downgraded" from macOS Ventura back to macOS Monterey on my 2019 Macbook Pro. Is there a way to migrate all the Firefox bookmarks and login/password info that I had prior to the downgrade? I made a complete backup of the computer prior to the downgrade, but I can't find any folders with this info on the backup, just the Firefox application. I didn't make the .html or .csv files of the bookmarks or login info prior to the downgrade--didn't think it would require such steps to migrate the old info.

title: Problema Extensão WebPKI (Lacuna) – bug
content:
Meu sistema operacional é MacOS (12.6.9) e tenho um certificado digital em nuvem (NeoID Serpro) para a minha empresa, o qual só pode ser usado em Firefox (117.0.1) no Mac.

Ocorre que preciso da extensão WebPKI (Lacuna Software) no Firefox para configurar o certificado direto na extensão, clicando em WebPKI e seguindo para Configurações/Cripto Dispositivos/Opções Personalizadas e inserindo o caminho "/Applications/NeoID Desktop.app/Contents/Java/tools/macos/libneoidp11.dylib", do contrário, o portal pelo qual eu emito minhas notas fiscais não reconhece o certificado.

Entretanto, quando clico no ícone da extensão, ela carrega o logo da extensão e fecha automaticamente depois disso (imagem 1), sem a possibilidade de realizar a configuração. Alguém com o mesmo problema?

Fiz essa mesma configuração no Chrome (imagem 2), porém, como escrevi acima, o NeoID não funciona no Chrome do Mac.

Preciso que o WebPKI funcionando no Firefox. Detalhe, já testei em outro Mac e não funcionou também. É um bug que não é exclusividade da minha máquina.

Alguém me ajuda? _/\_
creator: jacktainan

title: Subtitles in PIP are not updated when in the background on YouTube
content: 1. Go to YouTube in Firefox nightly, play a video, turn on subtitles and PIP. 2. Open a program other than QT and change it to full screen. 2-1. I just tested it, and it can be reproduced by simply minimizing Firefox. 3. Subtitles are not updated until the main Firefox window (not the PIP window) appears on the screen. 3-1. When I opened the QT program in full screen it worked fine (Firefox may not be aware that the QT program has obscured Firefox). 4. When the Firefox main window appears on the screen using any method such as Alt+Tab or Win key, the PIP subtitles are updated again. 4-1. Even if it is a GTK app, transparency is applied and the subtitles are updated when the Firefox main window is visible in the background. ※ I created a new profile for testing and tested it, and the same problem occurred.
creator: hunhee

title: iOS link preview cannot be disabled
content: I don't know if this is a system wide iOS issue or something specific to Firefox, but I'm not able to disable link preview when long pressing a link. I was able to disable it in Safari which also disabled it in iMessage, but link previews are still showing up in Firefox and Firefox Focus. It's very surprising for a browser focused on privacy and security. I should not have to make a connection to another server in order to see the URL behind a link. Automatically downloading from an unknown URL opens my device up to zero day exploits and privacy violations. Does anyone know how to disable this completely or submit a bug report to Firefox?

Hello,

I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to request the deactivation of my Firefox account associated with the email address stelios.polkas@ticketmaster.gr.

Regrettably, I have encountered an issue with my account due to the loss of my mobile device, which contained the necessary authentication for 2FA (Two-Factor Authentication). As a result, I am currently unable to access my Firefox account or any associated services.
